name: Yuanyi Zhong
body:
## Research Interests
Human and artificial intelligence/cognition (and their interaction), machine learning, computer vision, and cognitive science

## Education
### Tsinghua University
Beijing, China
B.Eng., Electronic Engineering, Expected: Summer 2017
 GPA: 92.3/100, rank: 5/195
### Rice University, Houston, Texas, USA
Exchange Student, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Fall 2015
 GPA: 4.17/4.0 (A+ corresponds to 4.33)

## Publications
1. Jing Zhang, Jie Tang, Yuanyi Zhong, Yuchen Mo, Jimeng Sun and Juanzi Li. \StructInf: Mining Structural Influence from Social Streams". In Proceedings of the 31st AAAI Conference on Arti cial Intelligence (AAAI'17). [PDF]
2. Yuanyi Zhong, Jiansheng Chen, Bo Huang. (title hidden due to anonymity) about CNN-based end-to-end face recognition by learning face alignment with a Spatial Transformer. under review for CVPR 2017

## Research Experiences
### Kanwisher Lab, Department of Brain and Cognitive Science,
Massachusetts Institute of Technology, MA
July - Aug 2016
Supervisor: Nancy Kanwisher, Ph.D; Collaborator: Matthew Peterson, Ph.D.
 Project: Real World Retinal Image Statistics (Ongoing)
Applying computer vision, deep learning and electronic engineering techniques,
to build a real-world retinal image collecting and eye tracking system, and
to test hypotheses regarding human visual cognition models, such as face
perception and individualized visual attention models.

### Center for Intelligent Image and Document Processing, Electronic Engineering,
Tsinghua University
Jan 2016 - Present
Supervisor: Jiansheng Chen, Ph.D.
 Project: CNN-based Face Detection, Alignment, and Recognition
Proposing an end-to-end face recognition system that learns alignment itself,
and a multi-task face detection network achieved by  ne-tuning GoogLeNet
(paper submitted to CVPR'17)
Collaborating with a company on deploying the proposed systems into products

### Knowledge Engineering Group (KEG), Computer Science,
Tsinghua University
Nov 2014 - Mar 2016
Supervisor: Jie Tang, Ph.D.
#### Project 1: Modeling Social Network Users via Deep Learning
Studied the problem of learning latent vector representations of users by
neural network embedding, as inspired by word2vec, and making link predictions;
Out-performed baseline matrix factorization method (AUC +5%)
#### Project 2: Mining Structural Influence from Social Streams
(collaboration with Jing Zhang, Ph.D.) URL: http://cn.aminer.org/structinf
Introduced the notion of structural influence on social networks;
Presented the exact and approximate algorithms to discover influence patterns;
My contribution: implementing the algorithm in C++, conducting experiments on Weibo data, and analyzing the results and error bounds.

### Efficient Computing Group (RECG), Electrical and Computer Engineering,
Rice University
Sept 2015 - Dec 2015
Supervisor: Lin Zhong, Ph.D.
 Project: Hacked into the ARM Cortex M3 hidden processor on BeagleBoneBlack embedded programming board; examined related security issues.
